reviewText: This CD "SENDS me!"  It is SO great with his style and grace of old songs.....the slow songs, are the BEST, and I keep playing them over and over....the band is FANTASTIC, and I cannot get it LOUD ENOUGH!!I am an audiophile, and was taught at an early age by my dad while growing up in CA.  I have moved from the West Coast, and with THIS CD, it allows me to "be me" again, to reflect, reminisce and regroup!LOVE IT!!Dawn

reviewText: Who am I? My grandma? Do I really want to watch Harry Connick, Jr. live? On PBS? I mean, I do like that "Antique Roadshow" program and I'm sure they've got some other decent stuff on there, but damn, PBS? Anyway, Mr. Connick does his best to convince everyone he's the second coming of Frank Sinatra (it's tough to say who's the better actor, however), crooning his way through "Save the Last Dance for Me", "The Very Thought of You" and many other standards. So how's ol' Harry do? Not really that well, to be honest. His mood is too subdued, his voice too average-it's like he's trying too hard to give people what they want. And what do people want? I'll tell ya: they want bonus material like interviews with Harry and the band, a photo gallery (why must every DVD come with a photo gallery?), and behind-the-scenes footage.
